page.title: 10EDUCATION PRIMARY TUNSTALL
page.content: The school was built in 1846, but did not include the cottages on either side. It has been extended over the year, most recently in 1981. The school is owned by The Church of England but the playing field is owned by Kent County Council. There are four full time and two part time teachers, including the Headmistress who has been at the school for 24 years. There are 150 pupils aged between five and eleven.Most pupils come by car even local children.The school has many after school activities especially music.On Friday mornings, they go swimming in Sittingbourne. School starts at 9.00am and ends at 3.45 pm.Lunch is served from 12.00-1.30pm in the village hall opposite the school.To get there pupils have to cross a dangerous road. Money was raised for the school at the village fete.
